name: Layered Monolith
description: Single deployable unit with layered architecture. Simpler to start, harder to scale.

name: Modular Monolith
description: A single deployable unit, but internally designed with strong module boundaries. A bridge to microservices.
template: Code-level modules, shared single DB, internal APIs/facades.

name: Microservices on Kubernetes
description: Decompose domain into independently deployable services, deployed on K8s with autoscaling.
template: API Gateway, Service Mesh, Horizontal Pod Autoscaling.

name: Event-driven Microservices
description: Use event streams to decouple services for real-time processing and horizontal scalability.
template: Kafka for streaming; stateless services; state stores for materialized views.

name: Serverless
description: Function-as-a-Service for event-driven workloads with automatic scaling and pay-per-use.
template: Cloud functions + managed event bus + managed DB.

name: Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA)
description: Coarse-grained services orchestrated via an Enterprise Service Bus (ESB).
template: ESB, SOAP/XML, shared data models, coarse-grained services.

name: CQRS + Event Sourcing
description: Separation of read/write models and use events as the source of truth.
template: Append-only event store, separate read models.

name: Data Warehouse (DWH)
description: Centralized repository for structured, historical data (ETL). Optimized for read-only analytics and BI reporting.
template: ETL pipelines, RDBMS/Columnar store (e.g., Redshift, BigQuery), BI tools.

name: Data Lake / Analytics
description: Centralized storage of raw and processed data for analytics and ML workloads.

name: Data Mesh
description: A decentralized, domain-driven approach to data architecture. Treats data as a product.
template: Domain-oriented data products, self-serve platform, federated governance.

name: Space-Based Architecture
description: Solves high-scalability problems by using replicated, in-memory data grids. No central database.
template: In-memory data grid (e.g., Hazelcast), processing units, local cache.
